clues.text: Robert Frost's "Mending Wall" ends with the phrase "Good fences make good" these
One of his poems for kids begins, "There is a place where the sidewalk ends and before the street begins"
Oliver Wendell Holmes wrote this poem as a call to help save the USS Constitution from demolition
He wrote, "Poems are made by fools like me, but only God can make a tree"
He wrote "Concord Hymn" for the dedication of a monument commemorating the 1775 battle
It's also the postal abbreviation for a New England state
It's first alphabetically of a news reporter's 5 Ws
To know this detergent introduced in 1959 is to know "everything" about laundry
From Latin for "separate", it means more than 2
Giant mutant ants were this 1954 movie title pronoun!
Best not have one of these on stage; if it breaks, it's 7 years bad luck & it also interferes with the lights
Hopefully it won't really happen, but instead of wishing an actor good luck, tell him to do this
Never say the name of this play in a theater or there may really be "double, double toil and trouble"
Never carry one of these feathers on stage--the evil eye may curse the show
For safety reasons & to ward off resentful spirits, don't turn off the light called this
These largest New World camelids don't normally spit at humans, but do at others of their kind
This fish with a William Tell-like name shoots water at insects above the surface to knock them in
This Chinese dish is made from the hardened spittle of a cave-dwelling swiftlet
These tusked creatures spit jets of water into the muddy ocean floor to loosen shellfish for eating
The ringhals, or "spitting", this snake doesn't spit venom to subdue prey, but to ward off attackers

rounds.comments: (Alex: These will be descriptive phrases from Old English or Norse.)

clues.text: Heaven's candle
Bone-house
Word-hoard
Battle-sweat
Treasure-seat
Emotion of a lover fearing infidelity; the ancient "wisdom of Solomon" says "the ear of" it "heareth all things"
Punning on a sports drink, it's what those driven by loathing are "drinking"
If you've seen Lewis Black do stand-up, you'll know why he was cast as the voice of this emotion in "Inside Out"
In the book "Take" this, Jessica Tracy says this sense of self-worth has led to many great accomplishments
A 2014 study trims the list of the traditional 6 basic emotions--it combines fear & this other one with eyebrows raised
De trommelaar, this person in a band
De bob--this person who gets friends home safely
In a casino, de handelaar
De oom--this relative if he really is Dutch
De spits--this goal-scoring soccer forward
In this novel, it is at a  ball that D'Artagnan kisses the queen's hand & is rewarded for his courage with the gift of a ring
No one survives a masked ball in Edgar Allan Poe's story "The Masque of" this colorful pestilence
May Welland's engagement to Newland Archer is announced at a ball early in this novel by Edith Wharton
One chapter of this tome includes "The Ball at Count Bennigsen's" & "Alexander's Letter to Napoleon"
In this novel the "lively & unreserved" Mr. Bingley "danced every dance" at a ball in Meryton
In 14th century Europe, plate armor superseded chain this
Markov chains are studied in this statistical branch of math theory, the study of chance & random phenomena
22 yards long & divided into 100 links, a gunter's chain is used in this land-measuring occupation
Ancient Greek philosophers came up with the idea of the "great chain of" this, linking God to the tiniest creatures
In Greek myth this hero breaks Andromeda's chains
She continues to get thousands of letters each year addressed to her in Verona
In "The Taming of the Shrew", she's the shrew tamed by Petruchio
Placed under a magic spell by her husband, this queen falls in love with the donkey-headed Nick Bottom
Though King Lear disinherited her, she was the only one of his 3 daughters who remained faithful to him
After pledging her love to King Priam's son, she betrays him & takes up with Diomedes
For the record, this emperor didn't actually fiddle while Rome burned because the fiddle didn't come until centuries later
In 1465 the archbishop of Mainz granted this printer an annual pension of grain, wine & clothes
During France's Reign of Terror, this wax modeler was forced to make death masks of freshly guillotined heads
After the death of Charles II came the "War of the Spanish" this, 1701 to 1714
In 1948, after celebrating 58 years as this country's queen, Wilhelmina abdicated in favor of her daughter
Logophile
Discophile
Sinophile, all things this country
Dendrophile
Ailurophile

rounds.text: The first of the 7 commandments in this 1945 novel is "Whatever goes upon two legs is an enemy"
